question_text: How do you configure flash drive boot and what are common troubleshooting steps?
answer_options: Flash drives cannot be used as boot devices in modern computers
Create bootable USB, enable USB boot in BIOS, set USB as first boot priority
Flash drives automatically boot without any BIOS configuration needed
Only external hard drives can be used for booting, not flash drives
correct_answer: Create bootable USB, enable USB boot in BIOS, set USB as first boot priority
explanation: Configuration: 1) Create bootable USB drive, 2) Enable USB boot in BIOS, 3) Set USB device as first boot priority, 4) Save and restart. Troubleshooting: verify USB drive is bootable, try different USB ports, disable secure boot if needed, confirm UEFI vs Legacy boot mode matches USB creation method, and check for USB drive recognition in BIOS.
